question: Rajasimheshvara or the Kailashnatha Temple was constructed during the reign of which of the following kings?
explanation: Narsimhavarman II popularly known as Rajasimha Pallava was a ruler of the Pallava kingdom from 700 A.D. to 728 A.D. He is credited with the construction of the Shore Temple, Isvara and Mukunda Temples in Mahabalipuram, the Panamalai Temple in South Arcot, plus the Kailasanathar Temple.
